sources.data_found: The new cluster comprises 60 nodes, 3968 cores, 22.5 TB RAM, and 32 NVIDIA GPUs. Easley will be a mixed-use Dell Hardware CPU/GPU cluster, incorporating H100 GPUs, which are among the most advanced graphics processing units available today.
Resources available to support this project include the 300-node/2400-core Wheeler compute cluster, the 32-node Xena NVIDIA GPU cluster, and the Taos condo compute cluster.

With support from Dell, Penguin Solutions, and Intersect360, they have built a cluster consisting of three nodes, each equipped with four Nvidia H100 NVL accelerators. (12 H100 NVL total for SC24 competition cluster)
In 2023, 5,193 degrees were awarded across all undergraduate and graduate programs at University of New Mexico-Main Campus.
UNM total enrollment is approximately 22,311 students. 12,124 are undergraduates and 3,062 are graduate students.
Total enrollment at the Albuquerque campus also grew to 23,228 for fall 2024, an increase of 2.6% (598 students) over last year.

student_data.notes: Specific CS enrollment numbers by degree level were not found. The CS department website and enrollment reports did not provide breakdowns of CS undergraduate, graduate, and PhD students separately. Total UNM enrollment for Fall 2024 is 23,228 students with 12,124 undergraduates and 3,062 graduate students university-wide. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: The 32-node Xena NVIDIA GPU cluster was mentioned but specific GPU models were not provided

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts include: 1) Easley cluster: 32 H100 GPUs (60 nodes total with 32 NVIDIA GPUs, specified as H100 in the description). 2) SC24 competition cluster: 3 nodes × 4 H100 NVL = 12 H100 NVL GPUs. 3) Xena GPU cluster: 32 nodes (GPU models unspecified). Wheeler is a CPU-only cluster. The H100s in Easley are counted as SXM based on typical Dell HPC cluster configurations, while the SC24 H100 NVLs are counted as PCIe.

analysis_notes: UNM CARC operates multiple clusters including the new Easley cluster (60 nodes with 32 H100 GPUs), the older Xena GPU cluster (32 nodes, GPU models unspecified), Wheeler CPU cluster (300 nodes), and Taos condo cluster. Specific CS department enrollment data was not publicly available despite multiple search attempts.
